long_desc.thetext:
(gnome-software:5533): Gs-ERROR **: CSS parsing error: not a number
Thread 1 "gnome-software" received signal SIGTRAP, Trace/breakpoint trap. 0x00007ffff467428b in g_logv () from /lib64/libglib-2.0.so.0 (gdb) where #0 0x00007ffff467428b in g_logv () from /lib64/libglib-2.0.so.0 #1 0x00007ffff46743ff in g_log () from /lib64/libglib-2.0.so.0 #2 0x00005555555a91cc in css_error () #3 0x00007ffff49413c5 in g_closure_invoke () from /lib64/libgobject-2.0.so.0 #4 0x00007ffff4953412 in signal_emit_unlocked_R () from /lib64/libgobject-2.0.so.0 #5 0x00007ffff495c03f in g_signal_emit_valist () from /lib64/libgobject-2.0.so.0 #6 0x00007ffff495c41f in g_signal_emit () from /lib64/libgobject-2.0.so.0 #7 0x00007ffff637847b in _gtk_css_parser_error () from /lib64/libgtk-3.so.0 #8 0x00007ffff63790e0 in gtk_css_dimension_value_parse () from /lib64/libgtk-3.so.0 #9 0x00007ffff6387001 in parse_font () from /lib64/libgtk-3.so.0 #10 0x00007ffff638506a in gtk_css_shorthand_property_parse_value () from /lib64/libgtk-3.so.0 #11 0x00007ffff637bfaf in gtk_css_provider_load_internal () from /lib64/libgtk-3.so.0 #12 0x00007ffff637d132 in gtk_css_provider_load_from_file () from /lib64/libgtk-3.so.0 #13 0x00005555555a8cf3 in theme_changed () #14 0x00005555555a926c in gs_application_initialize_ui.part () #15 0x00005555555a9798 in gs_application_activate () #16 0x00007ffff49415f4 in _g_closure_invoke_va () from /lib64/libgobject-2.0.so.0 #17 0x00007ffff495bdb9 in g_signal_emit_valist () from /lib64/libgobject-2.0.so.0 #18 0x00007ffff495c41f in g_signal_emit () from /lib64/libgobject-2.0.so.0 #19 0x00007ffff4c3012d in g_application_real_local_command_line () from /lib64/libgio-2.0.so.0 #20 0x00007ffff4c30322 in g_application_run () from /lib64/libgio-2.0.so.0 #21 0x0000555555570bff in main ()
If you can reproduce, I'd love the output of "gnome-software --verbose" Thanks!

This seems to be fixed now... I can no longer repoduce with gnome-software-3.21.2-1.fc25.x86_64.
Feel free to close.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.
